cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 210 mi SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Projected to move northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, re-emerge into the north-western Caribbean, then track NNW–N toward the central/northern Gulf of Mexico with a likely turn NNE toward the Alabama–Florida Panhandle coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near the Alabama / Florida Panhandle

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua northward to the Honduras border and Honduras coast east of Punta Castilla
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area (Central America) – no U.S. coastline under warning at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America (NIC, HON), Yucatán Peninsula, and northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Florida Panhandle and inland Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of experiencing sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions at most.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected given track well east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers possible as outer moisture skirts western Louisiana late weekend; heavy totals not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None of significance for port operations at this time.
